abstract: Islamic State threatens to kill Japanese hostage Kenji Goto and Jordanian pilot First Lt Moaz al-Kasasbeh if Jordan does not release attempted suicide bomber Sajida al-Rishawi from prison within 24 hours.
lead_paragraph: The Islamic State gave Jordan 24 hours or less to release a prisoner. If not, the militants said, they will kill not only a Japanese hostage, but also a captured Jordanian pilot

byline.contributor: Ranya Kadri contributed reporting from Amman, Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Lebanon, and Martin Fackler from Tokyo.

snippet: The Islamic State gave Jordan 24 hours or less to release a prisoner. If not, the militants said, they will kill not only a Japanese hostage, but also a captured Jordanian pilot

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

headline.main: Jordan Hostage Crisis May Hurt U.S. Ties
headline.print_headline: Jordan Hostage Crisis May Hurt U.S. Ties
